evidence.text: Plaintiffs bring this class action to challenge the federal government's policy of refusing to adjudicate their SIJS petitions in accordance with the Immigration and Nationality Act (INA). The government's blanket denial of SIJS for youth who obtain predicate SIJS orders after turning 18 but before the age of 21 violates the controlling statute and regulations.

extracted.value: violation of Immigration and Nationality Act (INA) and Administrative Procedure Act (APA)

evidence.text: declare Defendants’ ultra vires policy of rejecting SIJS findings issued by Washington state courts for youth ages 18 to 20 to be in violation of the INA and APA
enjoin any future denials of SIJS petitions on the basis that Washington state courts lacked the authority to reunify children with their parents
compel the government to rescind the improper SIJS denials already issued and reopen those SIJS petitions
require USCIS to adjudicate Plaintiffs’ and proposed class members’ SIJS petitions within 180 days after the date of filing, as required by statute

extracted.value: 8 U.S.C. § 1101(a)(27)(J)(i)-(ii), 8 U.S.C. § 1232(d)(2), and William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of 2008 (TVPRA)
